attributes.action: Cancel GCSE’s & A levels this year and give them their predicted grades instead.
attributes.additional_details: The Coronavirus will have caused much stress to the pupils and their family so it would be unfair to allow them to take the exam, and also would be unfair to postpone their academic future until next year. Furthermore, exam results will be unfair due to many students and their families being under extra pressure self-isolating at home and missing valuable learning time.
attributes.background: Confer with the exam boards and make the decision to cancel all GCSE’s and A Levels this year, and let the teachers award the pupils their grade based on their predicted results.

rejection.details:
The Government has closed all schools, colleges and universities, and exams have been cancelled. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/coronavirus-covid-19-cancellation-of-gcses-as-and-a-levels-in-2020/coronavirus-covid-19-cancellation-of-gcses-as-and-a-levels-in-2020

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus
